title: fix(enter): single-bucket balance deduction — no splitting, allow negative
author: voodoohop

gist.headline: One jar at a time
gist.blurb: We've streamlined how we deduct pollen credits. No more splitting costs across buckets—just clean, simple accounting that keeps your history tidy.
gist.summary: Switched to a single-bucket deduction model that allows temporary negative balances, ensuring requests succeed even if they slightly exceed current limits.
gist.impact: Users get a more reliable experience where requests don't fail on the margins, and balance history is much easier to understand.
gist.visual_concept: The bee mascot as a cozy shopkeeper managing honey jars. The focus is on simplicity—using one jar at a time rather than juggling many. Represents the 'single-bucket' logic.
gist.image_prompt: Cozy pixel art scene of the 8-bit bee mascot standing behind a wooden counter, scooping glowing honey from a single large jar. Cozy 8-bit pixel art aesthetic. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and pastel peach gradient background. Cute bee character with chunky retro sprites. Warm lighting, lo-fi vibes like Stardew Valley. Pixel text on jar: 'POLLEN'. Nostalgic but beautiful, emotionally warm.
